active.name: Aqua Mind
active.personality: Calm and calculating. Never rushes, always plans three moves ahead.
active.catchphrase: Flow like water, strike like a tsunami.

attacks.name: Splash
attacks.description: A simple but effective water attack

attacks.name: Tsunami
attacks.description: Massive wave that also heals the user

bench.name: Frost Guardian
bench.personality: The tank. Slow but incredibly durable. Protects the team.

attacks.name: Ice Shield
attacks.description: Defensive ice barrier that reduces next damage

bench.name: Tide Dancer
bench.personality: Graceful and evasive. Dances around attacks while striking back.
bench.catchphrase: Can't hit what you can't catch!

player1.name: Team Inferno
player1.thinking: Blaze Bot is weak to Aqua Mind's water attacks, which means we need to retreat to avoid extra damage. Pyro Mind can take the heat and deal with Aqua Mind's water type effectively.
player1.trashTalk: "You think you can drown the fire? I'm just getting warmed up, and it's about to get blazing hot in here!"

player2.name: Team Tsunami
player2.thinking: We are currently at a disadvantage with no energy, but the Blaze Bot is weak to our water type attacks. Although we can't attack this turn, we should focus on building energy for a powerful Tsunami next turn while preparing to switch if needed.
player2.trashTalk: "You think you can burn me down? Watch as I rise like the tide, and your flames fizzle out!"

events: ‚ö° Both players gain 1 energy
Team Inferno retreats Blaze Bot and sends out Pyro Mind!

player1.name: Team Inferno
player1.thinking: Given that Pyro Mind is weak to Aqua Mind's water type attacks, it's crucial to make a strategic retreat and bring in a fresh fighter. Ember Sprite has lower HP but could create an opening for a future attack, while Blaze Bot has higher HP and could withstand more damage. Choosing Blaze Bot will give us a sturdy front line, and since Aqua Mind is weak to electric attacks, we can play for the future if we can build energy.
player1.trashTalk: "You're all wet, Aqua Mind! Let‚Äôs see if you can handle the heat when the true firepower of Team Inferno steps up!"

player2.name: Team Tsunami
player2.thinking: With Aqua Mind's water type advantage against Pyro Mind's fire type, using Splash will deal 40 damage, putting Pyro Mind at a significant disadvantage. I will maximize damage while conserving energy for future turns.
player2.trashTalk: "You think fire can outlast the tide? Prepare to be washed away, Pyro Mind!"

events: ‚ö° Both players gain 1 energy
Aqua Mind uses Splash! It's SUPER EFFECTIVE! 40 damage!

player1.name: Team Inferno
player1.thinking: Our Pyro Mind is vulnerable to Aqua Mind's water attacks, and with only 1 energy, we can't hit back effectively. It's time to retreat to Blaze Bot, who has a full health advantage and can bring the heat with electric-type attacks in the future.
player1.trashTalk: "You think you can drown the flames of passion? Please, Aqua Mind, when I unleash Blaze Bot, it'll be a tidal wave of regret!"

player2.name: Team Tsunami
player2.thinking: With Pyro Mind weakened and vulnerable to my water type attack, I can finish it off with my available attack. I should utilize my energy efficiently to secure the KO while maintaining Aqua Mind‚Äôs strong position.
player2.trashTalk: "You‚Äôre nothing but a flickering flame, Pyro Mind! Prepare to be washed away by the tide of my skill!"

player1.name: Team Inferno
player1.thinking: Blaze Bot is in a dangerous position against Aqua Mind due to its water type advantage. With no energy to attack, I should retreat to a bench fighter to avoid unnecessary damage and regroup. Pyro Mind has decent HP and can take a hit, allowing us to strategize for a strong counterattack in the next turn.
player1.trashTalk: "You think you can drown the flames? You‚Äôre about to get scorched, Aqua Mind! Prepare for a fiery comeback!"

player2.name: Team Tsunami
player2.thinking: With Blaze Bot's fire type being weak to my water type, I can deliver a decisive blow. Since I have enough energy for a Splash attack, I should use it to maximize damage while keeping my Aqua Mind in play for future rounds.
player2.trashTalk: "You‚Äôre feeling the tide, Blaze Bot! Just wait until the waves crash over you!"

We'll need to conserve energy for a stronger attack while minimizing damage taken.

player2.name: Team Tsunami
player2.thinking: Aqua Mind has the advantage with its water type against Blaze Bot, which is weak to water attacks. Given the current energy constraints, using Splash will allow us to finish off Blaze Bot while conserving our options for the next turn.
player2.trashTalk: "You thought fire could extinguish the tide? Prepare to be swept away by the force of the ocean!"

player1.name: Team Inferno

player1.trashTalk: "You think you can drown the flames? Let‚Äôs see how long you can hold your breath, Aqua Mind!"

player2.name: Team Tsunami

I will use Ember to deal 30 damage and hopefully put some pressure on Aqua Mind before retreating to conserve my remaining fighter for a stronger comeback.
